resources.string: New version available. Update to get the most out of your app
This version of the app has expired.
Please uninstall and then install the latest version from Play Store.
Calibration is past its reagent expiry date
Please order a fresh batch of reagent and recalibrate
Place device face down on a flat surface
Do not move the phone during the test
Colour does not match any calibrated colours.
Check that the chamber has been placed correctly.
Retesting with dilution is recommended as level of contamination is high.
The camera does not meet the minimum requirements.\n\nFor best results, at least 8 megapixel camera required.
Can\'t use camera. Make sure flashlight is off and close any apps that may be using the camera
A back facing camera is required for colorimetric analysis
If the problem continues, restart this device
A camera flash was not found on this device
Do you want to calibrate now?
Screen pinned. Press \'Home\' button for more information.
Send details to support for assistance
Send information to our support team to help provide you with assistance in using the app.
Please select your email app in the next step and send the generated email.
This software incorporates material from the projects listed below
Calcium has to be less than or equal to Magnesium
Don\'t take sample yet. Hold camera above colour card and adjust position until check succeeds.

string.name: place_strip_clr_hg_1
string.b: Place a clean test strip below the used test strip so that patch has a white background.

resources.string: Place the stacked strips with the patch facing left on the black area of the Colour Reference Card and press Start.
DANGER: Hydrogen and arsine gases are generated during the test. Work in a well-ventilated area away from open flames and other sources of ignition.
Review Material Safety Data Sheets for safe handling, storage and disposal information. Dispose of in accordance with local regulations. Dispose of waste in accordance with environmental legislation.
Insert a test strip into the cap so the pad completely covers the small opening.
Close the flap and press to secure.
Fill the square measuring vial to the top with sample (9.6 mL).
Pour the sample into the reaction bottle.
If a rotten egg smell is detected after adding reagent #1, sulfide is present at interfering levels, [a topic=sulfide]click here[/a] to see how to remove sulfide before continuing.
Add one Reagent #2 powder pillow to the sample.
Immediately attach the cap to the reaction bottle.
Swirl continuously for 60 seconds. Do not shake or invert or allow sample to get on the strip.
Wait 20 minutes. Swirl twice during the reaction period.
Remove the test strip from the cap and immediately place the test strip facing left on the Colour Reference Card and press Start.
Fill HALF of the vial with sample water.
Samples containing more than 1500 mg/l K must be diluted with distilled water.
The pH must be within the range 5 – 14. Adjust, if necessary, with calcium hydroxide.
Close the reagent bottle and the tube containing the test strips immediately after use.
Rinse the test vessel with distilled water only.
Open one foil packet and add powder contents to vial.
Cap vial and shake rapidly for 5 seconds. Remove cap.
Dip a strip into sample and remove immediately.
Dip a strip in the sample for at least 2 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into sample vial and rapidly move back and forth underwater for 15 seconds.
Dip the strip into sample and move back and forth for 30 seconds in sample.
Dip the strip into 250+ ml sample and move back and forth for 60 seconds in sample.
Immerse the reaction zone of the test strip in the pretreated sample (15 – 30 °C) for 1 second
Dry off excess water. (e.g. place it on a towel)
Shake once the excess water from test strip.
Do not shake excess water from the test strip.
Allow excess liquid to run off via the long edge of the strip onto an absorbent paper towel.
Add 1 drop of reagent K-1 on the reaction zone and allow to react for 1 minute.
Fill the provided bottle with 5 ml of your water sample.
Add 10 drops of the NH4-1 Reagent to the sample.
Swirl the sample to mix the reagent.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 5 seconds and remove.
Shake excess water from the test strip.
Place the test strip with the patch facing left on the black area of the Colour Reference Card and press Start.
Add 5 drops of the PO4-1 Reagent to the sample.
Place smaller container in the provided rack.
Add 6 drops of the PO4-2 Reagent to the smaller container.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 15 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into the smaller tube for 15 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 1 second and remove.
Fill the reaction bottle with sample to the fill line (50 mL).
Complete the following steps to remove the sulfide before beginning the test procedure:
Tear off a small piece of cotton and form a ball the size of a pea.
Saturate the cotton with a few drops of lead acetate. Squeeze excess liquid out of the cotton, leaving it damp.

Press the saturated cotton ball into the small opening of the reaction bottle cap from the bottom. Be sure that the cotton is firmly in place and that a gap remains between the cotton and the top surface of the cap.
Insert the test strip as detailed in step 1 of the 0–500 or 0–4000 ppb test procedure and continue with the test.
Note: The lead acetate must not contact the test strip!
Always wear gloves or wash hands thoroughly after handling lead acetate.
Put strip on black area with colour patches to the left. Hold camera above colour card until measurement is complete.
Tilt camera in direction of arrow
Move camera closer to the card
Please avoid shadows on the card
